properties.description: Posted by Harvey

properties.name: Abbey Field Lake
properties.description: Posted by HarveyThe Abbey Field Lake was created by flooding part of the old castle moat system in the 1980s. It is popular with swans and other birds throughout the year.

properties.name: Castle Green
properties.description: Posted by HarveyNice area of old cottages facing the castle. Best seen when not too many cars.

properties.name: Coffee Bar and Internet Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Harvey  Gusto coffee bar. Something approaching continental standard coffee. Nice to sit outside on a good day.

properties.name: Coventry University Ellen Terry Building
properties.description: Posted by SwimaceCoventry University Ellen Terry Building

properties.name: Crackley Wods
properties.description: Posted by HarveyA delightfully unspoiled , if small, piece f old woodland.

properties.name: East Chase Farm
properties.description: Posted by HarveyAn excellent place to buy farm eggs at a good place. Also Christmas trees and logs.

properties.name: Good walking
properties.description: Posted by HarveyThe area behind the castle has many good footpaths and is popular with ramblers. Views of the castle are excellent.

properties.name: Houses in Dudley Rd.
properties.description: Posted by HarveyAt Christmas there are two houses absolutely dripping with lights. Santa Clause, elves, deer the whole bang-shoot.

properties.name: Kenilworth Golf Course
properties.description: Posted by Harvey The Club House for Kenilworth Golf Club.

properties.name: Kenilworth School
properties.description: Posted by Harvey

properties.name: Kites and slides
properties.description: Posted by HarveyThe small hills here a excellent, on a windy day, for kite flying. With a little snow the sledges come out.

properties.name: Near the Ford
properties.description: Posted by HarveyThe Ford between Abbey Fields and the Castle often floods after heavy rain.

properties.name: Nursery
properties.description: Posted by HarveySwaine\'s is well worth a trip. Plants are a good price and the owner knows his job

properties.name: Parliament Piece
properties.description: Posted by HarveyThis splendid meadow has been endowed to the town and is supposedly a site where Simon de Montfort conducted an early parliament. It is, in fact, called \'Parliament Piece\'.

properties.name: Pleasant, old allotment area
properties.description: Posted by Harvey Odibourne allotments. The stream is clearly visible. It is not un-common to get winter flooding.

properties.name: Real Ale Pub
properties.description: Posted by HarveyThe Bakers Oven is an attractive bar with a fine reputation for \'Real Ales\'.

properties.name: Sainsbury's
properties.description: Posted by HarveyNot a large supermarket - but the town\'s main one. Recently the car park has been taken over by some smart arsed commercial operator so you now pay. You have to buy ten pounds worth of shopping to get a refund. \'What a f***ing liberty!\'

properties.name: Swimming Pool
properties.description: Posted by Harvey  Abbey Fields swimming pool still retains the old, late Victorian, open air pool.

properties.name: Swimming pool
properties.description: Posted by Harvey

properties.name: Talisman Square
properties.description: Posted by HarveyTalisman Square - a small precinct of useful shops.

properties.name: Thatched cottage
properties.description: Posted by HarveyThe house of a friend - Peter James. Splendid views over Abbey Fields

properties.name: The Beefeater
properties.description: Posted by HarveyA chain pub/restaurant which looks OK, but the food os routine. It is popular, however.

properties.name: The Castle
properties.description: Posted by HarveySlendid old ruin where once Queen Elizabeth stayed. Also popular with her father Henry VIII. Often in the summer open air events take place in the grounds.

properties.name: The Clarendon Arms
properties.description: Posted by HarveyNice pub with some character. Food pretty good by pub stadards.

properties.name: The Club House
properties.description: Posted by Harvey Kenilworth Golf Club

properties.name: The Club House
properties.description: Posted by HarveyKenilworth Golf Course takes up an area to the east of the town

properties.name: The Common
properties.description: Posted by HarveyKenilworth Common. An area of open, wooded land with the railway running hrough it.

properties.name: The Library
properties.description: Posted by HarveyKenilworth Library

properties.name: The Mill
properties.description: Posted by HarveyVery distinctive building. A converted mill which is currently on sale for £1.25 million.

properties.name: The National Agriculture Centre
properties.description: Posted by HarveyLarge site used for big national agriculturalevents. The main one is \'The Royal Show\' which takes place in July.

properties.name: The Police Station
properties.description: Posted by HarveyRather small and no certainty that you will find it open.

properties.name: The Priory Theatre
properties.description: Posted by Harvey The Priory Theatre. A busy local amateur theatre.

properties.name: The Talisman Theatre
properties.description: Posted by Harvey The Talisman Theatre. An amateur theatre with a good reputation for standards. Ten one week productions a year and a two week Christmas Pantomime.

properties.name: The de Montfort Hotel
properties.description: Posted by Harvey Very much a place favoured by those \'in trade\'. A rip off spot for travelling salesmen.

properties.name: Virgin and Castle
properties.description: Posted by HarveyThe Virgin and Castle pub is a fine eighteenth century building with many period features

properties.name: Warwick University
properties.description: Posted by HarveyNot in Warwick, but in Coventry. One of the best post-war universities.
